Understate: The claim may understate the level of concern and awareness about the coronavirus threat at the time of Mardi Gras.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the absence of suggestions to cancel Mardi Gras means there was no need to cancel it, without considering other factors or potential alternative explanations.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that there was not a single suggestion by anyone to cancel Mardi Gras.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for why Mardi Gras was not canceled, such as political or economic considerations, that are not addressed in the claim.
